# User Flows and Processes — civicDebateBoard

Business workflows for civicDebateBoard enable consistent behavior across all core processes in clear business terms (WHAT to do). Technical implementations (architecture, APIs, database design, UI) remain at the discretion of the development team.

Related context for deeper background:
- See narrative personas and examples in the [User Personas and Scenarios](./04-user-personas-and-scenarios.md).
- Full capability rules are captured in the [Functional Requirements Specification](./06-functional-requirements.md).
- Policy definitions and enforcement guardrails are established in the [Content Moderation and Safety Policies](./07-content-moderation-and-safety-policies.md).

## Conventions and Roles Context
- Roles: member, verifiedMember, factChecker, moderator, admin.
- Content types: post, comment, reply, reaction, vote, report, annotation (fact-check), sanction, appeal, notification.
- Time and localization: Interpret deadlines and timestamps in the user’s configured timezone; maintain canonical timestamps per business rules in the [Functional Requirements Specification](./06-functional-requirements.md).
- EARS syntax: Applicable requirements use EARS keywords (WHEN, WHILE, IF, THEN, WHERE, THE, SHALL) in English; all descriptions in en-US.

## Global Preconditions and Shared Behaviors

### Authentication, Authorization, and State Gates
- THE platform SHALL require authentication for actions that modify state (posting, commenting, voting, reporting, annotating, moderating, appealing).
- THE platform SHALL evaluate role-based permissions and account state (active, muted, suspended, banned) before any mutating action.
- WHERE ownership is required, THE platform SHALL verify the actor is the content owner within allowed windows.
- WHEN a rate limit applies, THE platform SHALL calculate remaining quota and the next reset time and SHALL enforce the limit consistently across flows.

### Idempotency, Concurrency, and Conflict Handling
- WHEN repeated identical user actions occur within a short window (e.g., double-submit), THE platform SHALL process them idempotently so that only one effect is applied.
- WHEN a concurrent update would create a conflict (e.g., editing content that changed since fetch), THE platform SHALL deny the action with a conflict reason and SHALL preserve the user’s latest attempt as a new draft when applicable.

### Visibility States and Evidence
- THE platform SHALL treat visibility states as: public, limited (e.g., pending review), hidden (author and staff only), removed (tombstoned), and restored; transitions follow policy.
- THE platform SHALL capture immutable evidence snapshots for policy-relevant transitions (e.g., removal, label application, sanction issuance).

### Audit and Notifications
- THE platform SHALL record an immutable audit entry for actions affecting safety, visibility, roles, or account state.
- WHEN user-impacting outcomes occur (publish, reject, label, sanction, appeal decision), THE notification service SHALL send outcomes consistent with user preferences and mandatory policy notices.

## Posting and Editing Content Flow

### Business Description
Members publish civic discussion posts with titles, body text, tags, and topics. Certain content routes to pre-moderation based on trust signals and policy flags. Authors may edit their own posts subject to time-bound and policy constraints. Verified members may mark content as expert when permitted.

### Preconditions
- Authenticated as member or above.
- Account in good standing (not muted or suspended).
- Sufficient rate-limit budget.

### Primary Flow (Posting)
1. Author creates a draft with required fields.
2. System validates inputs and checks rate limits.
3. System evaluates pre-moderation requirement.
4. If pre-moderation is required, route to review queue; otherwise publish.
5. On publish, schedule notifications to followers/subscribers per preferences.

### Editing Flow
1. Author requests to edit own post.
2. System validates edit window, sanctions, and lock status.
3. Apply edit and record an immutable edit trail.
4. If the edit materially changes policy-sensitive content, temporarily hide and queue for re-review.

### Key Decisions
- Pre-moderation requirement.
- Edit window and re-review triggers.
- Sanctions and rate-limit status.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Posting + Editing)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(Author Authenticated)"] --> B["Create Draft(Post)"]
  B --> C["Validate Input & Rate Limits"]
  C --> D{"Valid & Within Limits?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["Reject with Errors"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F{"Pre-Moderation Needed?"}
  F -->|"Yes"| G["Queue for Review"]
  F -->|"No"| H["Publish Immediately"]
  G --> I{"Approved?"}
  I -->|"Yes"| H
  I -->|"No"| J["Reject with Policy Reason"]
  H --> K["Notify Subscribers/Followers"]
  K --> L["End(Post Visible)"]

  %% Editing sub-flow
  M["Author Requests Edit"] --> N["Check Edit Window & Sanctions"]
  N --> O{"Allowed?"}
  O -->|"No"| P["Deny Edit with Reason"]
  O -->|"Yes"| Q["Apply Edit & Record Trail"]
  Q --> R{"Triggers Re-Review?"}
  R -->|"Yes"| S["Temporarily Hide & Queue"]
  R -->|"No"| T["Keep Visible"]
  S --> U{"Approved?"}
  U -->|"Yes"| T
  U -->|"No"| V["Revert/Reject Edit"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE posting service SHALL require authentication as member or higher to create posts.
- THE posting service SHALL validate required fields: title (non-empty, max length per policy), body (non-empty), and at least one tag/topic where required by policy.
- WHERE the author is newly registered or under low-trust conditions, THE posting service SHALL route new posts to pre-moderation.
- WHEN input validation fails, THE posting service SHALL return a structured error containing field-level reasons.
- WHEN a post is published, THE notification service SHALL enqueue notifications to eligible subscribers within 1 minute.
- WHILE the post is in review, THE content visibility service SHALL set visibility to non-public and visible to moderators and the author.
- IF the review is rejected for policy reasons, THEN THE posting service SHALL notify the author with categorical reasons and next-step guidance.
- WHERE the edit occurs within the allowed self-edit window (e.g., 24 hours) and no sanctions apply, THE posting service SHALL allow edits and record an edit trail accessible to moderators.
- IF the edit materially changes sensitive content categories, THEN THE posting service SHALL temporarily hide the post and submit for re-review.
- WHEN rate limits are exhausted, THE posting service SHALL deny the action with a reset time.
- WHEN a verifiedMember marks a post as expert-tagged, THE posting service SHALL display an expert badge subject to verification policy.

### Error Handling and Recovery
- IF required fields are missing, THEN THE system SHALL provide explicit field names and constraints in the response message.
- IF the user is muted or suspended, THEN THE system SHALL block posting and include sanction type and end time.
- IF duplicate content is detected within a short window, THEN THE system SHALL reject with a duplicate warning.

### Performance and Rate Limiting Expectations
- WHEN a valid post is submitted without pre-moderation, THE system SHALL complete publication within 2 seconds under normal load.
- WHEN posts enter pre-moderation, THE system SHALL place the item in the review queue within 1 second and confirm receipt to the author.
- WHERE rate limits apply, THE system SHALL present remaining quota and next reset time in natural language.

## Commenting and Replying Flow

### Business Description
Users add comments to posts and replies to comments to facilitate threaded discussion. Comment visibility and edit rules mirror those of posts, but with shorter edit windows and stricter anti-spam controls.

### Preconditions
- Authenticated as member or above.
- Account not under comment-restrictive sanctions.
- Target post or parent comment is visible and open for comments.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Commenting)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(Authenticated)"] --> B["Select Target(Post/Comment)"]
  B --> C["Validate Target Visibility & Open State"]
  C --> D{"Allowed to Comment?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["Deny with Reason"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F["Create Draft(Comment)"]
  F --> G["Validate Content & Rate Limits"]
  G --> H{"Valid?"}
  H -->|"No"| I["Reject with Errors"]
  H -->|"Yes"| J{"Pre-Moderation Needed?"}
  J -->|"Yes"| K["Queue for Review"]
  J -->|"No"| L["Publish Comment"]
  K --> M{"Approved?"}
  M -->|"Yes"| L
  M -->|"No"| N["Reject with Policy Reason"]
  L --> O["Update Counts & Notify Participants"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE commenting service SHALL allow only authenticated users in good standing to submit comments.
- THE commenting service SHALL validate that the target is visible and open for comments before accepting content.
- WHERE anti-spam heuristics trigger, THE commenting service SHALL require pre-moderation for the comment.
- WHEN a comment is published, THE system SHALL notify the post author and recent participants subject to notification preferences.
- WHERE an edit occurs within a 30-minute window and no replies exist, THE commenting service SHALL allow self-edit with edit trail.
- IF the parent content is removed, THEN THE commenting service SHALL mark the comment’s visibility per policy (e.g., hidden with placeholder).

### Error Handling and Performance
- WHEN validation fails, THE system SHALL return field-specific messages within 2 seconds.
- WHEN a user exceeds comment rate limits, THE system SHALL block the action and provide reset time.

## Voting and Reactions Flow

### Business Description
Users express sentiment through votes (e.g., up/down) and reactions (e.g., agree, insightful). Each user may cast at most one vote per item and may update or retract it. Tallying is transparent and subject to anti-abuse controls.

### Preconditions
- Authenticated as member or above.
- Target content is visible and not locked.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Voting)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(Authenticated)"] --> B["Select Target Content"]
  B --> C["Check Visibility & Lock State"]
  C --> D{"Eligible?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["Deny(Not Eligible)"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F["Check Existing Vote"]
  F --> G{"Has Existing Vote?"}
  G -->|"No"| H["Apply New Vote"]
  G -->|"Yes"| I{"Same Direction?"}
  I -->|"Yes"| J["Retract Vote"]
  I -->|"No"| K["Update Vote Direction"]
  H --> L["Update Tally"]
  J --> L
  K --> L
  L --> M["Acknowledge & Notify(Optional)"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE voting service SHALL restrict each user to a single active vote per item at any time.
- WHEN a user submits the same vote twice, THE voting service SHALL interpret it as a retraction and update the tally accordingly.
- WHEN a user changes vote direction, THE voting service SHALL decrement the prior tally and increment the new tally atomically.
- WHERE the target content is locked, THE voting service SHALL reject voting with a lock reason.
- THE reactions service SHALL allow multiple reaction types per item but limit one per type per user.
- IF a user is sanctioned from participatory actions, THEN THE voting and reactions services SHALL deny the attempt with sanction details.

### Error Handling and Performance
- WHEN a valid vote/reaction request succeeds, THE system SHALL acknowledge within 1 second under normal load.
- IF the content reference is invalid, THEN THE system SHALL return a clear “not found or not visible” outcome without leaking private state.

## Reporting Content and Triage Flow

### Business Description
Users report content suspected of violating policy. Reports are categorized, prioritized, and routed to moderation queues. factChecker can attach annotations with sources and propose corrections. Moderators triage reports according to SLAs.

### Preconditions
- Reporter is authenticated (member or above) and not sanctioned from reporting.
- Target content exists and is visible to the reporter at the time of reporting.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Reporting & Triage)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(Reporter Authenticated)"] --> B["Select Content & Category"]
  B --> C["Validate Inputs & Duplicate Report Check"]
  C --> D{"Valid?"]
  D -->|"No"| E["Reject with Errors"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F["Create Report Record"]
  F --> G["Priority Scoring(Severity, Volume, Role)"]
  G --> H["Route to Queue(Policy/Topic)"]
  H --> I{"Auto-Action Threshold Met?"}
  I -->|"Yes"| J["Apply Temporary Hide"]
  I -->|"No"| K["Await Moderator Review"]
  J --> K
```

### Fact-Check Annotation Sub-flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Identify Claim in Content"] --> B["Create Annotation(Claim Excerpt)"]
  B --> C["Attach Sources(URLs) & Rating"]
  C --> D{"Complete & Within Limits?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["Reject with Field Errors"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F["Publish Annotation"]
  F --> G["Notify Moderators & Author"]
  G --> H{"Label/Action Needed?"}
  H -->|"Yes"| I["Queue for Moderator Review"]
  H -->|"No"| J["Visible Without Enforcement"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE reporting service SHALL require a category selection from the defined policy taxonomy for every report.
- THE reporting service SHALL deduplicate substantially identical reports within a defined time window to prevent spam.
- WHERE severity or report volume crosses thresholds, THE reporting service SHALL temporarily hide the content pending review.
- WHEN a factChecker adds an annotation, THE system SHALL link the annotation to the reported content and make it available to moderators.
- WHEN a report is submitted, THE system SHALL confirm receipt to the reporter within 2 seconds and provide a reference ID.
- THE annotation workflow SHALL require at least one valid source URL, a rating, and an explanation to publish an annotation by a factChecker.
- WHEN an annotation is published, THE system SHALL display an annotation badge and SHALL notify the content author and relevant subscribers.

### Error Handling and SLAs
- THE reporting service SHALL prevent reports on content the reporter cannot see.
- THE moderation triage process SHALL surface high-priority items to moderators within 1 minute of report submission.

## Moderation Review and Enforcement Flow

### Business Description
Moderators review reported or queued content, assess against policy, and choose outcomes: approve, edit with transparency note, remove, warn, mute, suspend, or escalate to admin. All actions create audit logs and user notifications with clear reasons.

### Preconditions
- Moderator or admin authenticated with appropriate privileges.
- Evidence (reports, prior history, annotations) accessible.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Moderation)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(Moderator Assigned)"] --> B["Open Case & Review Evidence"]
  B --> C{"Policy Violation?"}
  C -->|"No"| D["Approve/Restore Content"]
  C -->|"Yes"| E{"Severity Level"]
  E --> F["Edit with Transparency Note"]
  E --> G["Remove Content"]
  E --> H["Issue Warning"]
  E --> I["Apply Mute/Suspension"]
  E --> J["Escalate to Admin"]
  D --> K["Notify Reporter & Author"]
  F --> K
  G --> K
  H --> K
  I --> K
  J --> L["Admin Decision"] --> K
  K --> M["Close Case & Log Audit"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE moderation service SHALL present consolidated evidence including reports, prior violations, and factChecker annotations.
- WHEN no violation is found, THE moderation service SHALL approve or restore the content and notify involved parties.
- WHERE a minor violation is identified, THE moderation service SHALL allow corrective edits with a transparency note.
- WHERE policy prohibits the content, THE moderation service SHALL remove the content and preserve an evidence snapshot.
- WHERE behavior warrants sanctions, THE moderation service SHALL apply warnings, mutes, or suspensions per configured policy tiers.
- WHEN a case requires higher authority, THE moderation service SHALL support escalation to admin with case context.
- THE moderation service SHALL create immutable audit logs for every action, including actor, timestamp, and rationale category.

### Error Handling and SLAs
- WHEN a moderation action is taken, THE system SHALL notify affected users within 1 minute with clear reason categories and appeal instructions.
- WHERE automatic actions temporarily hid content, THE system SHALL reconcile visibility within 1 minute after final decision.

## Appeals and Reinstatement Flow

### Business Description
Users may appeal moderation actions within a defined window. Appeals are reviewed by a different moderator or an admin depending on severity and result in uphold, partial modification, or reversal.

### Preconditions
- Appellant authenticated and is the subject of the action or the content author.
- Appeal within allowed time window and includes a reason.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Appeals)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start(User Files Appeal)"] --> B["Validate Eligibility & Window"]
  B --> C{"Eligible?"}
  C -->|"No"| D["Reject Appeal with Reason"]
  C -->|"Yes"| E["Create Appeal Case"]
  E --> F["Assign Reviewer(Independence Rule)"]
  F --> G["Review Evidence & Rationale"]
  G --> H{"Outcome"}
  H --> I["Uphold"]
  H --> J["Modify(Partial)"]
  H --> K["Reverse"]
  I --> L["Notify Parties & Close"]
  J --> L
  K --> L
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE appeals service SHALL require appellants to provide a reason tied to predefined categories.
- THE appeals service SHALL enforce an independence rule such that the original moderator does not decide the appeal.
- WHEN an appeal is filed, THE system SHALL acknowledge receipt within 2 seconds and provide a tracking ID.
- WHEN an appeal decision is recorded, THE system SHALL notify all relevant parties and update content visibility and sanctions accordingly.
- WHERE reversal occurs, THE appeals service SHALL restore content and remove or annotate sanctions as appropriate.

### Error Handling and SLAs
- IF the appeal is out of window or lacks required information, THEN THE system SHALL reject with guidance on eligibility and timing.
- THE appeals queue SHALL present new appeals to eligible reviewers within 5 minutes of submission.

## Onboarding and Verification Flow

### Business Description
Visitors register, verify email, and complete basic profile steps. Users may request elevation to verifiedMember by submitting identity or expertise evidence. Admins or designated verifiers adjudicate requests.

### Preconditions
- For registration: unauthenticated visitor.
- For verification: authenticated user in good standing.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Onboarding & Verification)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Start Registration"] --> B["Provide Email & Password"]
  B --> C["Create Account(Pending Verification)"]
  C --> D["Send Verification Email"]
  D --> E{"Email Verified?"}
  E -->|"No"| F["Limit Access(Grace Period)"]
  E -->|"Yes"| G["Activate Member Role"]
  G --> H["Optional: Complete Profile"]
  H --> I{"Apply for Verification?"]
  I -->|"No"| J["End(Member)"]
  I -->|"Yes"| K["Submit Evidence & Rationale"]
  K --> L["Queue for Verifier Review"]
  L --> M{"Approved?"}
  M -->|"Yes"| N["Elevate to verifiedMember"]
  M -->|"No"| O["Deny with Reason & Cooldown"]
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE onboarding service SHALL require email verification before granting full member privileges.
- WHILE the email is unverified within the grace period, THE onboarding service SHALL restrict posting and interaction capabilities per policy.
- WHEN verification succeeds, THE onboarding service SHALL activate the member role and record the verification timestamp.
- WHEN a user applies for verifiedMember, THE verification service SHALL require evidence and a rationale.
- THE verification service SHALL maintain an auditable decision with reviewer identity and decision reason.
- IF a verification request is denied, THEN THE verification service SHALL impose a cooldown period before re-application.

### Error Handling and Performance
- WHEN verification links are followed, THE system SHALL process activation within 2 seconds and provide clear status.
- IF the verification link is expired or already used, THEN THE system SHALL present a safe re-issue path.

## Notification Delivery Flow

### Business Description
Notifications inform users about relevant events (e.g., new comments, moderation outcomes, appeal updates). Users set preferences for delivery types (instant or digest) and categories. The system batches and rate limits notifications to prevent overload.

### Preconditions
- Trigger event occurs from another process.
- Recipient has not muted the category and is eligible under policy.

### Mermaid Flow Diagram (Notifications)
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Event Triggered"] --> B["Resolve Recipients & Preferences"]
  B --> C["Apply Eligibility & Mute Rules"]
  C --> D{"Any Recipients?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["End(No Delivery)"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F{"Delivery Mode"}
  F --> G["Instant Queue"]
  F --> H["Digest Queue"]
  G --> I["Send Notification"]
  H --> J["Aggregate & Schedule"]
  I --> K["Acknowledge"]
  J --> K
```

### EARS-Formatted Requirements
- THE notification service SHALL respect per-user category preferences for instant or digest delivery modes.
- WHERE recipients exceed batching thresholds, THE notification service SHALL aggregate events into a digest according to schedule rules.
- WHEN a moderation or appeal decision occurs, THE notification service SHALL deliver outcome notifications within 1 minute.
- IF a user has muted a category, THEN THE notification service SHALL suppress those notifications except for mandatory compliance notices.
- THE notification service SHALL mark notifications as read/unread based on user interactions recorded by other flows.

### Error Handling and Performance
- WHEN an instant notification is enqueued, THE system SHALL attempt delivery within 1 minute under normal operating conditions.
- IF a delivery attempt fails, THEN THE system SHALL retry based on a backoff schedule and record a delivery status for audit.

## Cross-Role Considerations and Guardrails
- WHERE a user’s account state changes (mute, suspension, reinstatement), THE system SHALL enforce the new state consistently across all flows without delay.
- THE system SHALL ensure that factChecker annotations do not directly impose sanctions but are highly visible to moderators in related cases.
- THE system SHALL ensure that admin can perform all moderator actions and manage role elevations and policy configurations.

## Additional Global EARS Requirements
- THE platform SHALL ensure idempotent processing for publish, edit, vote, react, report, annotate, and appeal submission actions within a 60-second window.
- WHEN a content item transitions visibility state, THE platform SHALL update search/discovery eligibility within 60 seconds.
- WHEN a thread is locked by a moderator, THE platform SHALL deny new comments and edits by non-staff immediately, with a lock reason.
- IF a mention targets a user who has blocked the author, THEN THE platform SHALL prevent the mention and SHALL not notify the blocked user.
- WHERE a sanction expires, THE platform SHALL restore previously restricted capabilities automatically without user action.
- WHEN content is restored after appeal, THE platform SHALL notify the author and SHALL re-enable discovery within 60 seconds.

## Performance Summary (User-Observable Targets)
- Publish (no pre-mod): ≤ 2 s; Pre-mod queueing: ≤ 1 s; Notification enqueue: ≤ 1 min.
- Comment publish: ≤ 2 s; Validation error response: ≤ 2 s.
- Vote/Reaction acknowledgement: ≤ 1 s; Cross-session reflection: ≤ 2–5 s.
- Report submission acknowledgement: ≤ 2 s; Triage surfacing (high-priority): ≤ 1 min.
- Moderation decision propagation: ≤ 1 min to affected users; Visibility reconciliation: ≤ 1 min.
- Appeal receipt acknowledgement: ≤ 2 s; Assignment to reviewer: ≤ 5 min; Decision notifications: immediate on decision.
- Email verification processing: ≤ 2 s; Verification re-issue path available for expired/used links.
- Notification delivery for instant events: ≤ 1 min; Digest aggregation per schedule.

files.content:
# Functional Requirements for civicDebateBoard

Business-functional rules define WHAT civicDebateBoard must do for users without prescribing technical implementations. All enforceable requirements use EARS to ensure clarity and testability. Developers have full autonomy over architecture, APIs, and data models; the statements below express business behavior only.

## 1) Introduction and Scope
- Purpose: Provide unambiguous, testable rules governing content creation, discussion, organization, discovery, subscriptions, notifications, personalization, localization, accessibility, and cross-cutting policies.
- In Scope: Posts, comments/replies, threads, reactions/votes, fact-check annotations, tags/topics/categories, search and discovery, notifications and subscriptions, bookmarks and follows, localization/timezone, accessibility and inclusivity, content states and visibility, error handling, rate limits, ownership and accountability.
- Out of Scope: Technical mechanisms (APIs, DB schemas, infra), UI layout/visual design, low-level implementation details.
- Roles: member, verifiedMember, factChecker, moderator, admin.

## 2) Content Model and Relationships (conceptual, non-technical)
Conceptual entities and relationships (business meaning):
- Post: Root item of a discussion with title, body, optional attachments/links, tags, topics, exactly one category.
- Comment: Reply to a Post or another Comment with exactly one parent; forms hierarchical chains with a defined maximum depth.
- Thread: A Post and all its descendant Comments.
- Reaction/Vote: Per-user expression on an item; one per user per item per reaction type.
- Fact-Check Annotation: Structured note by factChecker attached to a specific Post or Comment with citations.
- Report: User-initiated flag for policy or quality issues.
- Topic: Thematic grouping that users can follow.
- Tag: Keyword label; may be controlled (curated) or free-form (normalized).
- Category: Curated taxonomy node; each Post selects exactly one active Category.
- Subscription: User preference to receive updates about authors, threads, topics, or category digests.
- Bookmark: User’s saved reference to content.

Conceptual relationship overview:
```mermaid
graph LR
  U["User"] --> P["Post"]
  P --> C["Comment"]
  C --> C2["Comment(Reply)"]
  P --> R1["Reaction/Vote"]
  C --> R2["Reaction/Vote"]
  P --> FC1["Fact-Check Annotation"]
  C --> FC2["Fact-Check Annotation"]
  P --> REP1["Report"]
  C --> REP2["Report"]
  P --> TG["Tag"]
  P --> TP["Topic"]
  P --> CAT["Category"]
  U --> SUB["Subscription"]
  U --> BM["Bookmark"]
```

EARS requirements (core):
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL treat a Post as the root item of a thread with a title and body.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL treat a Comment as a reply to a Post or another Comment with exactly one parent.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow one Reaction/Vote per user per item per reaction type and allow removal at any time.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL associate zero or more Tags and zero or more Topics to a Post.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require exactly one Category for each Post selected from the active taxonomy.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow factChecker to attach Fact-Check Annotations to Posts and Comments.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow any authenticated user to create a Report on Posts and Comments within rate limits.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow any authenticated user to create Bookmarks on Posts and Comments.

## 3) Threading and Discussion Rules
### 3.1 Participation and Permissions
- WHERE role is "member" or "verifiedMember", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL permit creating Posts and Comments subject to policy and rate limits.
- WHERE role is "factChecker", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL permit creating Posts and Comments and SHALL permit adding Fact-Check Annotations.
- WHERE role is "moderator" or "admin", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL permit all posting/commenting and SHALL permit enforcement actions per policy.
- IF user is unauthenticated, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny creating Posts or Comments and SHALL present an appropriate error.
- WHERE account is muted or suspended, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny posting/commenting and SHALL show remaining sanction duration.

### 3.2 Validation Rules for Posts
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require Post titles with length 10–150 characters.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require Post bodies with length 20–50,000 characters.
- WHERE Post includes attachments, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow up to 5 attachments per Post with cumulative size up to 25 MB.
- WHERE Post includes external links, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require each link to use http or https and include a resolvable hostname.
- WHERE role is "verifiedMember" and the post is marked as expert-tagged, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require a topic area selection and an expertise declaration note up to 500 characters.
- WHERE content warnings are used, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow authors to select one or more warning categories (e.g., graphic, sensitive, adult) and SHALL gate visibility accordingly.

### 3.3 Validation Rules for Comments
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require Comment bodies with length 1–20,000 characters.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow up to 3 attachments per Comment with cumulative size up to 10 MB.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow a maximum reply depth of 5 levels including the root Post.

### 3.4 Mentions and Handle Rules
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow mentions using a handle format 3–30 characters, alphanumeric plus underscores and hyphens, starting with a letter.
- IF a mentioned user has blocked the author, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prevent the mention and SHALL inform the author without notifying the blocked user.
- IF a handle does not match the allowed format, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the content with a field-specific message.

### 3.5 Edits, Deletions, and Locking
- WHEN a user edits their own Post, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow edits for 24 hours from creation unless the Post is locked or sanctioned.
- WHEN a user edits their own Comment, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow edits for 60 minutes from creation unless the thread is locked or sanctioned.
- WHEN content is edited, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL preserve prior versions for audit visibility to moderators and admins.
- IF a thread is locked by a moderator, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prohibit new Comments and further edits by non-moderators.
- IF a Post is deleted by its author within 24 hours and has no Comments, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL remove it from public discovery and SHALL retain a soft-deleted record for 30 days for audit.
- IF a Comment is deleted by its author within 60 minutes, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL replace it with a tombstone indicating deletion by author.
- WHERE content is removed by policy, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL show a standardized placeholder indicating removal reason to users permitted to see the placeholder.

### 3.6 Reactions and Voting
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support one upvote per user per item and allow removal (toggle behavior on duplicate).
- WHERE reaction types include "upvote" and "respectful" reactions, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL limit to one per user per item per type.
- IF a user attempts to react to their own content, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action with an explanatory message.

### 3.7 Fact-Check Annotations
- WHERE role is "factChecker", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow an annotation with: claim excerpt (1–1,000), rating (e.g., accurate, needs context, misleading, false), at least one source (valid http/https URL), and explanation (1–2,000).
- WHEN an annotation is published, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL display an annotation badge and a link to the note within 1 minute.
- IF an annotation is flagged for policy issues, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL queue it for moderator review and SHALL withhold visibility until resolved for enforcement-affecting labels.

### 3.8 Content States and Visibility
States (business-level): Draft, Published, Pending Review, Locked, Soft-Deleted, Removed by Policy, Under Moderation Hold.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL maintain a state for each content item among the defined states.
- WHEN content is Pending Review or Under Moderation Hold, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL restrict visibility to the author, moderators, and admins.
- WHEN content is Locked, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow reads and SHALL deny new comments/edits by non-moderators.
- WHEN content is Soft-Deleted by the author, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL remove it from public discovery and SHALL allow moderators to view for 30 days.
- WHEN content is Removed by Policy, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL keep an audit reference accessible to moderators and admins and SHALL present a removal placeholder to eligible viewers.

## 4) Tagging, Topics, and Categories
### 4.1 Tags
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow 0–10 tags per Post, each 1–30 characters, alphanumeric plus hyphens.
- WHERE tags are controlled, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL restrict selection to approved tags; WHERE tags are free-form, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL normalize case and trim whitespace.
- IF any tag violates length or character rules, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the submission with tag-specific messages.

### 4.2 Topics
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow Post authors to associate 0–5 Topics with each Post.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to follow Topics to receive notifications and discovery prioritization.
- IF a Topic is deprecated by admins, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prevent new associations and SHALL preserve existing associations on historical content.

### 4.3 Categories
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require exactly one Category per Post chosen from the active taxonomy.
- WHERE a Category is changed by a moderator for policy reasons, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL update the Post categorization and SHALL record a moderation note.

## 5) Search and Discovery (filters, sorting)
### 5.1 Search Inputs and Validation
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL accept keyword queries 1–100 characters and SHALL ignore stopwords.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support filtering by Category, Topic, Tag, author, role (author type), time range, and content type (Post or Comment).
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support exclusion filters for Tags and Topics.
- WHERE illegal or dangerous query patterns are detected (e.g., CSAM indicators), THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny search and SHALL log a safety event.

### 5.2 Sorting Rules and Tie-Breakers
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support sorting by newest, oldest, most upvoted (24h, 7d, 30d, all-time), most commented (24h, 7d, 30d, all-time), and relevance for keyword queries.
- WHERE no sort is specified, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL default to newest for non-search results and relevance for search results.
- WHERE multiple items tie on a primary sort key, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL break ties using recency (newer first) and THEN by stable identifier.

### 5.3 Pagination and Limits
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL return results in pages of 20 items by default with options of 10, 20, or 50 per page.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL cap total retrievable pages at 100 per query to ensure fair use.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prevent requesting negative pages, zero page size, or sizes exceeding 50.

### 5.4 Safety and Quality in Discovery
- IF a Post is under active moderation hold, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL exclude it from public discovery until resolved.
- WHERE fact-check annotations exist, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL surface an annotation indicator in listings and SHALL allow filtering by annotation rating.
- WHERE content warnings are present, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL display warning indicators in discovery and SHALL respect user preferences for gating.

Search flow (business-level):
```mermaid
graph LR
  Q["Receive Query(Keyword/Filters)"] --> V["Validate Inputs"]
  V --> D{"Valid?"}
  D -->|"No"| E["Reject with Messages"]
  D -->|"Yes"| F["Apply Safety Exclusions"]
  F --> S["Apply Sort & Pagination"]
  S --> R["Return Results Page"]
```

## 6) Notifications and Subscriptions
### 6.1 Subscription Types and Preferences
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to subscribe to author updates, thread updates, Topic updates, and Category digests.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to configure instant vs digest delivery and to mute categories (except mandatory compliance notices).
- WHERE quiet hours are set, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL defer non-urgent notifications to outside the quiet window.

### 6.2 Triggering Events and Latency Expectations
- WHEN a subscribed thread receives a new Comment, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL notify subscribers within 1 minute.
- WHEN a user is mentioned, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL notify the mentioned user within 1 minute.
- WHEN a factChecker publishes an annotation on a Post, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL notify the Post author and thread subscribers within 5 minutes.
- WHERE Category digests are enabled, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL send a daily summary including top items by votes and comments.

### 6.3 Frequency, Bundling, and Opt-Outs
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL bundle notifications for the same thread within a 10-minute window.
- IF a user disables notifications for a specific thread, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL cease further notifications for that thread until re-enabled.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL provide per-category opt-out that takes effect within 1 minute of change.

Notification flow (business-level):
```mermaid
graph LR
  E["Event Occurs(Reply/Mention/Annotation)"] --> RCV["Resolve Recipients & Preferences"]
  RCV --> FIL["Apply Mutes & Quiet Hours"]
  FIL --> BND{"Bundle Window?"}
  BND -->|"Yes"| AGG["Aggregate into Bundle"]
  BND -->|"No"| QN["Queue Instant Delivery"]
  AGG --> SND["Schedule Send"]
  QN --> SND
  SND --> ACK["Mark Delivered/Failed"]
```

## 7) Bookmarks and Follows
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to bookmark Posts and Comments for later reference.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to follow authors and Topics to personalize discovery and notifications.
- IF a user unfollows an author or Topic, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL immediately stop related notifications and SHALL de-prioritize content from those sources in personalized lists.
- WHERE limits are required for system health, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL cap bookmarks at 2,000 per user and follows at 1,000 authors and 1,000 topics per user.
- IF a user attempts to exceed bookmark or follow limits, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action and SHALL present the applicable limit.

## 8) Localization and Timezone Handling (business perspective)
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL store and present timestamps relative to the user’s preferred timezone while preserving canonical audit time.
- WHERE a preferred timezone is not set, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL default to a reasonable timezone based on locale or device signals.
- WHERE scheduled publication is used, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL interpret schedule times in the author’s selected timezone and SHALL display both local and canonical times in metadata.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow language preferences for interface text and filters while preserving original content language for authored items.

## 9) Accessibility and Inclusivity Expectations
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require alt text for image attachments with length 5–500 characters.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support content warnings for sensitive topics and SHALL allow users to proceed or skip as per preferences.
- WHERE audio or video attachments are allowed, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require caption files or transcripts to be provided by the uploader before public discovery.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL support respectful discourse by disallowing harassment and hate content per policy and by enabling reporting and moderation flows.

## 10) Cross-Cutting Business Rules
### 10.1 Rate Limiting and Fairness
- WHERE role is "member", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL limit to 10 Posts per 24 hours and 100 Comments per 24 hours.
- WHERE role is "verifiedMember", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL limit to 20 Posts per 24 hours and 200 Comments per 24 hours.
- WHERE role is "factChecker", THE civicDebateBoard SHALL limit annotations to 100 per 24 hours and otherwise follow verifiedMember limits.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL limit reactions to 500 per 24 hours per user and reports to 50 per 24 hours per user.
- IF a rate limit is exceeded, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action with a message indicating the limit and reset time.

### 10.2 Attachments and Links
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow attachment types permitted by policy (e.g., images, documents) and SHALL disallow executable formats.
- IF an attachment or link is detected as malicious or policy-violating, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL block it and SHALL record a safety event.
- WHERE images are uploaded, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require reasonable dimension limits (e.g., up to 10,000×10,000 pixels) and SHALL enforce total size limits per item.

### 10.3 Mentions, Blocks, and Mutes
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to block others which prevents mentions and direct notifications.
- IF a blocked user attempts to interact (mention, follow) with the blocker’s content, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action and SHALL avoid notifying the blocker.
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL allow users to mute topics or authors to reduce visibility and notifications from those sources.

### 10.4 Ownership and Accountability
- THE civicDebateBoard SHALL attribute all content to a single author account and SHALL record role attributes at time of posting for accountability.
- WHERE a user changes role (e.g., becomes verifiedMember), THE civicDebateBoard SHALL not retroactively alter role labels on existing content.

## 11) Role-Based Capabilities Summary (business perspective)

| Action | member | verifiedMember | factChecker | moderator | admin |
|--------|--------|----------------|------------|-----------|-------|
| Create Post | ✅ | ✅ (can mark expert) | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Create Comment | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Edit own Post (24h) | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Edit own Comment (60m) | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |
| React/Vote | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Fact-Check Annotation | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ✅ (review/approve) | ✅ |
| Lock/Unlock Thread | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Change Category | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Remove Violating Content | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ✅ |
| Issue Sanctions | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ✅ |

Notes: Moderators and admins inherit content capabilities and add enforcement controls per policies.

## 12) Acceptance Criteria (EARS for all applicable requirements)
Consolidated, testable criteria complement the rules above.

### 12.1 Posting and Commenting
- WHEN a Post with title length 10–150 and body length 20–50,000 is submitted by a permitted role, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL accept and publish it within 2 seconds.
- IF a Post title is outside 10–150 characters, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the Post with a title-length message.
- IF a Post body is outside 20–50,000 characters, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the Post with a body-length message.
- WHEN a Comment with body length 1–20,000 at a depth ≤ 5 is submitted, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL accept and publish it within 2 seconds.
- IF a Comment would exceed depth 5, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject it with a depth-limit message.
- IF the author is muted or suspended, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny posting and SHALL present remaining sanction duration.

### 12.2 Edits, Deletions, and States
- WHEN an author edits a Post within 24 hours and the thread is not locked, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL save the new version and SHALL maintain immutable history for moderators.
- IF a user attempts to edit a Post after 24 hours, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the edit and SHALL indicate the elapsed window.
- WHEN an author deletes a Post within 24 hours that has no Comments, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL remove it from discovery and SHALL retain a soft-deleted record for 30 days.
- WHEN an author deletes a Comment within 60 minutes, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL replace it with a tombstone label.
- WHEN content is placed Under Moderation Hold, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL hide it from public discovery and SHALL show status to the author.

### 12.3 Reactions and Voting
- WHEN a user upvotes an item they did not author and has not previously upvoted, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL record the upvote and SHALL increase the count immediately.
- WHEN a user repeats an upvote on the same item, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL remove their upvote (toggle behavior).
- IF a user attempts to upvote their own content, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action with an explanatory message.

### 12.4 Mentions and Blocks
- WHEN a handle matches the allowed format, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL resolve the mention and SHALL notify the mentioned user unless they have blocked the author.
- IF a handle fails format validation, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the submission with a handle-format message.
- IF a mentioned user has blocked the author, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prevent the mention and SHALL inform the author.

### 12.5 Fact-Check Annotations
- WHEN a factChecker submits an annotation with required fields and at least one valid URL, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL publish the annotation and SHALL display a badge within 1 minute.
- IF required fields are missing or URLs are invalid, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the annotation with field-specific messages.

### 12.6 Tags, Topics, Categories
- WHEN a Post includes 0–10 valid tags, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL accept and store them; IF any tag violates rules, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the Post with tag-specific messages.
- WHEN a Post includes a Category from the active taxonomy, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL accept it; IF missing or invalid, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL reject the submission.
- WHEN a deprecated Topic is selected, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL prevent association and SHALL report the deprecation to the author.

### 12.7 Search and Discovery
- WHEN a keyword query 1–100 characters is submitted, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL return results sorted by relevance unless another sort is chosen, with default page size 20.
- WHERE filters (Category, Topic, Tag, author, role, time range, content type) are applied, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL restrict results accordingly.
- IF a content item is Under Moderation Hold, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL exclude it from public discovery results.
- IF a query matches illegal or dangerous patterns, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the search and SHALL log a safety event.

### 12.8 Notifications and Subscriptions
- WHEN a subscribed thread receives a new Comment, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deliver a notification within 1 minute and SHALL bundle events within 10 minutes.
- WHEN a user is mentioned, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL notify within 1 minute unless the mentioned user has blocked the author or muted the category.
- WHEN a fact-check is published on a Post, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL notify the Post author and thread subscribers within 5 minutes.
- WHEN a user sets quiet hours, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL defer non-urgent notifications until quiet hours end.

### 12.9 Bookmarks and Follows
- WHEN a user bookmarks content and is under the 2,000-bookmark cap, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL record it and SHALL make it retrievable in saved items.
- WHEN a user follows an author/topic and is under cap, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL include related content in personalized discovery and SHALL generate notifications per settings.
- IF a user exceeds bookmark or follow caps, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL deny the action and SHALL present the applicable cap.
- IF a user unfollows, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL cease related notifications immediately and SHALL de-prioritize related content in personalized lists.

### 12.10 Localization and Timezones
- WHEN a user sets a preferred timezone, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL display timestamps in that timezone and SHALL retain canonical timestamps for audit.
- WHEN a Post is scheduled for publication at a local time, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL publish according to the author’s timezone and SHALL display local and canonical times.

### 12.11 Accessibility and Inclusivity
- WHEN an image is uploaded, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require alt text 5–500 characters.
- WHERE sensitive content warnings are set, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL gate content behind a warning until the user opts to proceed.
- WHEN audio/video is uploaded, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL require captions or transcripts before public discovery.

### 12.12 Rate Limits and Abuse Prevention
- WHEN a user reaches a rate limit for Posts, Comments, reactions, or reports, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL return a clear error including remaining cooldown time.
- IF repeated violation attempts occur after rate-limit errors, THEN THE civicDebateBoard SHALL extend cooldown and SHALL log a potential abuse event for moderation review.

## 13) Error Handling and Recovery — User-Facing Expectations
- WHEN validation fails, THE civicDebateBoard SHALL present field-specific reasons and SHALL preserve unsaved user input for resubmission.
- WHEN a referenced target is not visible (e.g., parent removed), THE civicDebateBoard SHALL return a non-disclosing not-available message.
- WHEN background processing delays discovery (e.g., indexing), THE civicDebateBoard SHALL present the item in direct thread views while it propagates to search.

## 14) References to Related Documents
- For end-to-end workflows, see the [User Flows and Processes](./05-user-flows-and-processes.md).
- For content safety, sanctions, and enforcement specifics, see the [Content Moderation and Safety Policies](./07-content-moderation-and-safety-policies.md).
- For performance, availability, and operability targets, see the [Non-Functional Requirements and SLAs](./08-non-functional-requirements-and-slas.md).

# Content Moderation and Safety Policies for civicDebateBoard

## Policy Principles and Scope

### Guiding Principles
- Safety First: Protect users from harm, harassment, exploitation, and illegal activity.
- Civility and Civic Value: Promote constructive, well-sourced debate and discourage manipulation.
- Fairness and Consistency: Apply policies uniformly with documented rationales.
- Transparency and Accountability: Provide clear reasons for actions and maintain auditability.
- Due Process: Offer notice, the ability to appeal, and restorative options where appropriate.
- Proportionality: Match enforcement severity to violation severity and user history.
- Context Sensitivity: Consider intent, context, public-interest value, educational or newsworthiness exceptions.
- Legal Compliance: Respect applicable laws and regulatory obligations across jurisdictions.

### Scope of Application
- Applies to all user-generated content (UGC): posts, comments, profile fields, attachments, links, tags, reactions, and account metadata disclosures.
- Applies to all roles: member, verifiedMember, factChecker, moderator, admin.
- Covers policy enforcement, user reporting, labeling and annotations, sanctions, transparency notices, appeals, audit trails, and emergency escalations.
- Includes both proactive enforcement (e.g., automated pre-flagging) and reactive enforcement (e.g., user and partner reports).

### Moderator Conduct and Recusal
- Conflict of Interest: Moderators must recuse themselves from cases where impartiality may be compromised (e.g., personal relationships, prior disputes, organizational affiliations).
- Professional Conduct: Decisions must reference policy categories, document rationales, and avoid personal or ideological commentary.
- Independence of Appeals: Appeals must be reviewed by a different moderator or an admin for permanent bans.

## Prohibited and Restricted Content Categories

Restricted content requires labels, contextualization, age-gating, or limited distribution. Prohibited content requires removal and potential account sanctions. Context exceptions may apply for news reporting, educational materials, or public-interest documentation where clearly labeled and accompanied by context.

| Category | Definition (business-level) | Status | Notes and Handling |
|---------|------------------------------|--------|--------------------|
| Illegal Content | Content that violates applicable laws (e.g., CSAM, explicit criminal facilitation) | Prohibited | Immediate removal and admin escalation; emergency escalation for child safety |
| Child Exploitation | Any sexualization of minors, grooming, endangerment | Prohibited | Immediate removal; immediate emergency workflow activation and evidence preservation |
| Terrorism and Extremism | Praise/support of designated extremist orgs or operational content | Prohibited | Removal; account sanctions; preserve evidence; consider law-enforcement referral |
| Hate Speech | Direct attacks on protected classes (race, religion, gender identity, etc.) | Prohibited | Removal; strikes and sanctions calibrated by severity and context |
| Harassment & Threats | Targeted harassment, credible threats, stalking, doxxing | Prohibited | Removal; urgent threat assessment and escalations |
| Graphic Violence | Gratuitous gore or celebration of violence | Prohibited | Removal; limited exceptions for news or human-rights documentation with labels |
| Non-Consensual Intimate Imagery | Sexual/explicit imagery shared without consent | Prohibited | Removal; immediate account suspension pending review |
| Privacy Violations (Doxxing) | Publishing private identifying information without consent | Prohibited | Removal; evaluate imminent harm; rapid action |
| Self-Harm and Suicide Promotion | Encouraging self-harm or suicide | Prohibited | Removal; provide crisis resources; supportive discussion allowed with guardrails |
| Misinformation with Imminent Harm | False claims likely to cause real-world harm (health, safety, civic process) | Restricted/Prohibited | Label/reduce distribution or remove depending on harm/risk assessment |
| Election Integrity Violations | Coordinated voter suppression, false voting logistics | Prohibited | Removal; high-priority escalation during election windows |
| Medical Misinformation | Provably false medical claims contradicting leading public health bodies | Restricted | Label and reduce distribution; removal if imminently harmful |
| Spam and Scams | Mass unsolicited content, phishing, financial scams | Prohibited | Removal; apply automated cool-down and strikes |
| Platform Manipulation | Coordinated inauthentic behavior, astroturfing, vote brigading | Prohibited | Removal; deamplify; investigate related accounts |
| Impersonation and Deceptive Identity | Misrepresenting identity or affiliation, deepfake impersonations | Restricted/Prohibited | Label or remove; require disclosure; sanction repeat abuse |
| Copyright and Plagiarism | Unauthorized reproduction of copyrighted material | Restricted/Prohibited | Remove upon valid notice; repeat infringement may trigger suspension |
| Adult Sexual Content | Explicit adult content | Restricted | Age-gate, label, and limit distribution; follow jurisdictional rules |
| Sensitive Media | Disturbing but newsworthy content (e.g., war reporting) | Restricted | Allow with strong labels and click-through warnings |
| Profanity and Rude Behavior | Non-targeted profanity | Allowed/Restricted | Allowed unless targeted; repeated abuse may trigger actions |
| Off-Topic/Low-Quality | Content misaligned with civicDebateBoard’s civic discourse goals | Restricted | Downrank or move; removal after repeated abuse |
| Synthetic/Manipulated Media | Materially deceptive edits without disclosure | Restricted/Prohibited | Require disclosure labels; remove where it causes imminent harm |

### Category-Specific Handling Examples (Business)
- Non-consensual intimate imagery: Fast-track to P0 with immediate content removal and temporary account disable pending review.
- Election-related false logistics (e.g., wrong voting date): P0 during election windows; remove and apply strikes; add corrective banner when appropriate.
- Newsworthy graphic content (e.g., war crimes documentation): Allow with strong interstitial labels and age-gating; limit distribution.

## Civic Discourse Safeguards (Election Integrity and Misinformation Handling)

### Core Safeguards
- Election Windows: Elevated protections start 90 days before and end 14 days after scheduled elections relevant to the user’s locale.
- Claim Typology: Distinguish factual claims from opinion/analysis; apply annotations only on factual claims.
- Source Citation: Encourage references to credible sources for significant civic claims and expert-tagged posts.
- Distribution Controls: Reduce distribution of labeled misinformation, prevent trending and recommendations, and consider comment limits for high-risk items.
- Entity Disclosure: Label accounts that disclose affiliations to campaigns, governments, or NGOs; require disclosure for official spokespeople.

### Fact-Checking and Annotations
- factChecker Role: Add claim-level annotations, ratings (true/misleading/unfounded/needs context), and citations; cannot sanction directly.
- Moderator Review: Apply labels, reduce distribution, or remove content based on harm assessment and policy fit; require citation alignment.
- Author and Reader Notice: Notify authors upon annotation/labeling; show concise summaries with links to sources for readers.

## Report Intake and Prioritization

### Intake Channels and Metadata
- In-line Content Reports: Reporting from content context with category selection and optional notes.
- Out-of-Content Reports: Reports on profiles/messages via dedicated reporting entry.
- System Flags: Automated signals (burst activity, new-account patterns) that generate reports.
- Trusted Partner Reports: Pre-vetted organizations submitting high-priority notices for categories such as election integrity and child safety.

### False-Report and Reporter Abuse Handling
- Bad-Faith Reporting: Repeated inaccurate or harassing reports are a form of abuse.
- Reporter Reputation: Reporter accuracy is tracked to weight prioritization; chronic abusers may face limits.

### Prioritization Rubric
- Severity Tiers:
  - Critical (P0): Child safety, credible violent threats, voter suppression, non-consensual intimate imagery.
  - High (P1): Hate speech, doxxing, terrorism support, imminent-harm misinformation.
  - Medium (P2): Harassment, platform manipulation, medical misinformation without imminent harm, copyright notices.
  - Low (P3): Spam, off-topic, profanity, low-quality content.
- Reporter Trust Weighting: Reports by verifiedMember, factChecker, moderator, and trusted partners receive elevated priority.
- Recency/Velocity: Recent posts with high engagement escalate within tier.
- Duplicate Report Merging: Multiple reports for the same item are aggregated; unique reporter count influences priority.

### Triage Workflow (Business-Level)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Report Intake"
    A["User/System Submits Report"] --> B["Capture Metadata(Category, Notes, Reporter Role)"]
    B --> C["Assign Severity Tier(P0-P3)"]
  end
  subgraph "Queueing"
    C --> D["Merge Duplicates"]
    D --> E["Apply Priority Weighting"]
  end
  subgraph "Review"
    E --> F{"Harm Likely?"}
    F -->|"Yes"| G["Fast-Track to Moderator"]
    F -->|"No"| H["Standard Queue"]
  end
  G --> I["Immediate Interim Action(Label/Hide)"]
  H --> I
  I --> J["Assignment to Reviewer"]
```

## Review SLAs and Escalation Paths

### Service-Level Objectives (business expectations)
- Continuous review operations with enhanced responsiveness during civic or emergency periods.

| Severity | First Action Deadline (from report) | Final Decision Deadline | Escalation Trigger |
|----------|-------------------------------------|-------------------------|--------------------|
| P0 Critical | 15 minutes | 2 hours | Immediate escalation to senior moderator; admin if legal risk or ongoing harm |
| P1 High | 1 hour | 12 hours | Escalate if backlog > 1 hour or repeat violations |
| P2 Medium | 6 hours | 48 hours | Escalate if trending or duplicates exceed 10 |
| P3 Low | 24 hours | 5 days | Escalate if duplicates exceed 25 or author has 3+ recent strikes |
| Election Window P0 | 10 minutes | 1 hour | Auto-notify admin and factChecker group |

### Escalation Paths (business logic)
- Moderator → Senior Moderator: Triggered by severity thresholds, legal sensitivity, repeated violations, or conflict of interest.
- Senior Moderator → Admin: Triggered by legal obligations, public-interest exceptions, government requests, or platform-wide risk.
- Emergency Referral: Child safety or credible threats to life follow emergency process with immediate action and post-facto review.
- Legal Requests: Potential law-enforcement requests are logged and handled by admins consistent with compliance requirements.

## Sanctions and Transparency

### Sanction Types and Durations

| Sanction | Description | Default Duration | Applicability |
|----------|-------------|------------------|---------------|
| Content Removal | Remove violating content | Permanent | All prohibited categories |
| Warning | Formal notice for minor or first-time violations | N/A | P2–P3 violations |
| Labeling | Add context labels or fact-check notes | Until resolved/updated | Misinformation, sensitive media |
| Limited Participation | Reduce posting/comment cadence (cool-down) | 24–72 hours | Harassment, spam, low-quality |
| Temporary Mute | Block posting/commenting | 24 hours to 14 days | Repeated harassment, hate speech |
| Shadow Deamplification | Reduce distribution without blocking access | 7–30 days | Manipulation, low-quality |
| Temporary Suspension | Disable account access | 7–30 days | Severe or repeated violations |
| Permanent Ban | Terminate account | Permanent | CSAM, extremism, chronic abuse |

### Sanction Ladder by Category (Default Calibration)

| Category Group | First Confirmed Violation | Second Within 90 Days | Third Within 90 Days |
|----------------|---------------------------|-----------------------|----------------------|
| P3 Minor (spam, low-quality, profanity) | Warning or limited participation(24h) | Limited participation(72h) | Temporary mute(24–72h) |
| P2 Moderate (harassment non-targeted, copyright on notice) | Content removal + warning | Temporary mute(24–72h) | Temporary suspension(7d) |
| P1 Severe (hate speech, doxxing, extremism support non-operational) | Content removal + temporary suspension(7–14d) | Suspension(14–30d) + strike | Suspension(30d) + ban review |
| P0 Critical (child safety, non-consensual intimate imagery, credible threats, voter suppression) | Immediate disable + ban review | Permanent ban | Permanent ban |

Strike Policy
- Three-strike escalation: Three P1 violations within 90 days lead to 30-day suspension; any confirmed P0 triggers immediate permanent ban review.
- Strike Decay: Strikes older than 180 days are excluded from automatic escalations.

### Role-Based Authority
- moderator: Remove content, issue warnings, apply labels, impose limited participation, apply temporary mutes/suspensions up to 14 days, and escalate to admin.
- admin: All moderator actions plus suspensions up to permanent ban, policy configuration, and exception approvals.
- factChecker: Add annotations and propose labels; cannot apply sanctions.
- verifiedMember and member: Report content and appeal sanctions on their own content.

### Transparency and User Notice
- Action Notices: Clear reason, policy category, evidence summary, and appeal option with deadlines.
- Public Transparency Log: Anonymized aggregate statistics published periodically (counts by category, sanction type, resolution time) without exposing personal data.
- Remediation Guidance: Provide corrective steps where appropriate (e.g., edit with context, cite sources).

## Evidence Handling and Audit Trails

- Evidence Capture: Preserve exact content, timestamps, author identifiers, reporter role, and context pointers at report and enforcement times.
- Chain of Custody: Record each handling step with actor role, action type, timestamp, and rationale.
- Retention: Keep evidence for at least 365 days from final resolution, or longer if required by law or active appeal.
- Access Control: Restrict evidence access to moderators and admins; factCheckers may view content context for annotations but not sensitive personal data.
- Redaction: Redact personal identifiers from case summaries shared beyond the moderation team.

## Appeals and Restorative Processes

- Appeal Window: 14 days for most sanctions; 7 days for election-related actions.
- Independent Review: By a reviewer different from the original decision-maker; admins review permanent-ban appeals.
- Restorative Options: Educational prompts, edits, or contextualization to reinstate visibility when policy allows.
- Outcome Notifications: Clear decisions with updated rationales and references to policy categories.
- Rate Limits: One appeal per decision unless new evidence emerges.

### Appeals Workflow (Business-Level)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Appeal Submission"
    A["User Submits Appeal"] --> B["Validate Eligibility(Window, Single Appeal)"]
  end
  subgraph "Review and Decision"
    B --> C["Assign Different Reviewer"]
    C --> D{"Uphold or Overturn?"}
  end
  D -->|"Uphold"| E["Notify User and Maintain Sanction"]
  D -->|"Overturn"| F["Reinstate Content/Access and Clear Strike"]
  E --> G["Log Outcome in Audit Trail"]
  F --> G
```

## EARS-Formatted Enforcement Requirements

### General Policy Application
- THE moderation system SHALL apply the most severe applicable policy category when multiple categories are triggered by the same content.
- THE moderation system SHALL preserve a snapshot of content and metadata at the time of report and at the time of enforcement.
- THE moderation system SHALL record actor role, action, timestamp, and rationale for every enforcement action.

### Reporting and Intake
- WHEN a user submits a report with a selected category, THE moderation system SHALL capture category, free-text notes up to 1,000 characters, reporter role, and timestamp.
- WHEN duplicate reports target the same content, THE moderation system SHALL merge them into a single case while preserving reporter counts and roles.
- WHERE the reporter is a trusted partner or factChecker, THE moderation system SHALL assign at least P1 priority unless the content already has P0 triggers.
- WHILE content is under review for P0 or P1, THE moderation system SHALL prevent the content from appearing in recommendations and trending lists.
- WHERE a reporter’s recent accuracy rate falls below 20% over 30 days, THE moderation system SHALL downgrade the reporter’s prioritization weight and may apply reporting cooldowns.
- IF a reporter submits harassing or fraudulent reports repeatedly (≥ 5 invalid reports within 7 days), THEN THE moderation system SHALL impose a reporting cooldown of at least 72 hours and SHALL record a strike against reporter abuse.

### Prioritization and SLAs
- WHEN a report is categorized as P0, THE moderation system SHALL present it to a moderator within 15 minutes and record the presentation timestamp.
- WHEN a report is categorized as P1, THE moderation system SHALL present it to a moderator within 1 hour.
- WHEN a report is categorized as P2, THE moderation system SHALL present it to a moderator within 6 hours.
- WHEN a report is categorized as P3, THE moderation system SHALL present it to a moderator within 24 hours.
- WHILE under an election window, THE moderation system SHALL apply the Election Window SLA table to P0 items.

### Interim Actions and Labels
- WHEN harm assessment is pending for P0 or P1, THE moderation system SHALL allow moderators to apply interim actions: temporary hide, label, or limit distribution, with rationale capture.
- WHERE content is labeled as misinformation, THE moderation system SHALL show fact-check annotations and reduce distribution for the labeled item until updated or removed.
- WHERE synthetic/manipulated media lacks disclosure, THE moderation system SHALL apply a disclosure label and limit distribution pending author correction or moderator decision.

### Sanctions and Strikes
- WHEN content is removed for a Prohibited category, THE moderation system SHALL add one strike to the author’s account with category and date.
- WHERE a user accrues three P1 strikes within 90 days, THE moderation system SHALL apply a 30-day suspension.
- IF a P0 violation is confirmed, THEN THE moderation system SHALL disable the account pending admin review for permanent ban.
- WHERE a strike becomes older than 180 days, THE moderation system SHALL exclude it from automatic escalation calculations.
- WHEN a warning is issued, THE moderation system SHALL record it without adding a strike.
- WHERE violation category maps to the sanction ladder, THE moderation system SHALL apply the default sanction unless an admin-approved exception is recorded with rationale.

### Role-Based Permissions and Recusal
- WHERE the actor role is moderator, THE moderation system SHALL permit content removal, warnings, labels, limited participation, mutes up to 14 days, and suspensions up to 14 days.
- WHERE the actor role is admin, THE moderation system SHALL permit permanent bans and configuration of sanction durations and policies.
- WHERE the actor role is factChecker, THE moderation system SHALL permit creating annotations and proposing labels but SHALL prohibit sanctions.
- WHEN a moderator is assigned a case that presents a conflict of interest, THE moderation system SHALL allow and record recusal and SHALL reassign the case automatically.

### Transparency and Notices
- WHEN an enforcement action is applied, THE moderation system SHALL notify the author with the policy category, a concise explanation up to 500 characters, evidence summary reference, and appeal deadline.
- WHEN a label is applied to content, THE moderation system SHALL notify the author and provide sources used for labeling.
- WHERE a public transparency report is generated, THE moderation system SHALL include counts by category, average time to first action, and appeal outcomes by month.
- WHERE a decision is reversed on appeal, THE moderation system SHALL remove associated strikes and update the transparency metrics within 24 hours.

### Evidence and Audit
- WHEN evidence is captured, THE moderation system SHALL store the snapshot alongside case identifiers and prevent edits.
- WHERE a case is accessed by a reviewer, THE moderation system SHALL log the access with role and purpose.
- IF an appeal overturns a decision, THEN THE moderation system SHALL link the new decision to the original case and mark the original rationale as superseded.
- WHERE a legal hold is established, THE moderation system SHALL suspend routine deletion of relevant evidence until the hold is lifted.

### Appeals and Restorative Processes
- WHEN a user appeals within the allowed window, THE moderation system SHALL route the case to a different reviewer.
- WHERE a decision is upheld, THE moderation system SHALL allow exactly one appeal per decision unless new evidence is attached.
- WHERE a restorative option is offered, THE moderation system SHALL reinstate content visibility upon completion or compliant edits.
- WHEN a permanent ban appeal is granted, THE moderation system SHALL downgrade sanctions to suspension and SHALL define a probation period of 30–90 days with enhanced monitoring.

### Civic Safeguards
- WHEN election-related misinformation is detected, THE moderation system SHALL apply the election SLA and prioritize review over non-election P1 items.
- WHERE an account self-identifies as part of a political campaign, THE moderation system SHALL display affiliation labels on posts and profile per disclosure data.
- WHEN a factChecker publishes an annotation on a claim, THE moderation system SHALL notify moderators and reduce distribution for the annotated item until reviewed.
- WHERE a coordinated manipulation cluster is detected during election windows, THE moderation system SHALL deamplify implicated content, freeze related accounts for review, and notify admins.

## Special Procedures (Business-Level)

### Child Safety and Credible Threats
- Immediate Action: P0 fast-track; temporary disable of content and implicated accounts pending review; evidence capture prioritized.
- Lawful Referral: Admin evaluates and coordinates any legally required referrals.

### Moderator Conflict-of-Interest Handling
- Automatic prompts for recusal on signals like prior direct interactions or declared affiliations; reassignment recorded in audit.

## User-Facing Error and Recovery Scenarios (Business)
- Misfiled Report: Reporter selects wrong category. Outcome: Case remains valid; category can be corrected by reviewer; reporter receives outcome summary regardless.
- Sanctioned While Posting: User starts writing before sanction and attempts to publish during sanction. Outcome: Publish denied with remaining sanction duration; draft preserved.
- Label Dispute: Author disagrees with misinformation label. Outcome: Appeal path available; upon successful appeal, label removed and strike cleared.

## Policy Versioning and Change Management
- Versioned Policies: Each enforcement references a policy version identifier.
- Change Notices: Material policy changes communicated to users; moderators briefed prior to enforcement; transparency report notes effective dates.

## Related Documents
- Refer to the [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) for role definitions and session behaviors.
- Refer to the [User Flows and Processes Guide](./05-user-flows-and-processes.md) for end-to-end business workflows.
- Refer to the [Security, Privacy, and Compliance Requirements](./09-security-privacy-and-compliance.md) for privacy, security, and legal obligations.
